titlestmt.titleproper: College of Physicians of Philadelphia Council records 1868-1988
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: College of Physicians of Philadelphia Council records

bioghist.p: The College of Physicians of Philadelphia, founded in 1787, is the oldest professional medical organization in the country. The College is home to the MÃ¼tter Museum and the Historical Medical Library. The Council of the College of Physicians was established in 1863 to provide supervision over the affairs of the College. The Council consists of officers of the College, chairmen of standing committees, ex-presidents of the College, and the executive director.

scopecontent.p: This is a small collection of records of the Council of the College of Physicians of Philadelphia. Materials include: a Council resolution regarding unsuitability of women physicians, 1868; rough meeting minutes of the Council (typed and manuscript), 1896-1909; a set of rules of the Council, 1958; minutes of the Council (1976-1988), and miscellaneous offprints of articles.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
